intro: Camellia yungkiangensis, commonly known as the Yungkiang camellia, is a rare evergreen shrub native to China. It belongs to the Theaceae family and is characterized by its large, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep red. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions with cool, humid climates. Its leaves are dark green and glossy, and the flowers bloom in late autumn to early winter. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered an endangered species.
